benchmark_details.name: Synthetic MediaLiteracy Test (SMeL Test)
benchmark_details.overview: The SMeL Test is a benchmark that tests the ability of language models to actively filter out untrustworthy information in context. It evaluates how consistently models prioritize reliable sources over unreliable ones.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To measure how language models judge the trustworthiness of information presented in context.

data.source: Synthetic documents generated in the style of various sources including academic, news, and fictional writings.
data.annotation: Documents were generated using models to ensure unique and controlled content.

methodology.calculation: Hallucination rates are calculated based on how often models incorrectly include unreliable information in responses.
methodology.interpretation: Lower hallucination rates indicate better performance in prioritizing trustworthy over untrustworthy sources.
methodology.validation: Models were validated on both synthetic and real datasets to assess generalizability.
